instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 Random Power-On Issues
threads.message:
[B]History[/B]

Board came in no-power with minor corrosion on C1930 and R1931. Replaced both as part of the initial clean up pass. No other signs of any corrosion/junk anywhere else.

[B]Symptoms[/B]

Board behaves, randomly, in different ways when power is applied.

1) Powers on drawing either 0.180, 0.200, or 0.250 amps, fan spins, fan goes off and it falls back to 0.025, then powers back on with original amperage. The readings below are from this state, as it's the most common occurrence. USB light, but no activity. No caps-lock activity. 80% of the time.
2) Powers on and sticks at 0.025. 20% of time.
3) This is the odd one -> Powers on and works completely normally, flashing folder mark, etc, but no backlight. Very rarely, but I've got it to do this twice.

[B]Readings[/B]

PPBUS_G3H: 8.57
HS_COMP: 8.57
HS_OTHER: 8.58
PPDCIN_G3H: 18.15
PP3V42_G3H: 3.44
PPVRTC_G3H: 3.31

PP5V_S4RS3: 5.1
PP5V_S0: 5.0
PP3V3_S5: 3.31
PP3V3_S4: 3.31

PP3V3_S3: 3.31
PP3V3_S0: 3.31
PP3V3_S4SW_SNS: 3.31
PP1V8_S3: 1.79
PP1V2_S3: 1.2

PP1V5_S0: 1.5
PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT: 0.6

PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK: 3.44
PLT_RESET_L: 3.3
RTC_RESET_L: 3.3

threads.title: 820-00165 Random Power-On Issues
threads.message:
Try original Magsafe 2 charger.
Also test the board alone, disconnecting LIO flex and other peripherals.

threads.title: 820-00165 Random Power-On Issues
threads.message: The board is completely stripped from the machine, nothing attached. I?ve swapped for a known good IO board and flex, and I?ve tried it on a genuine charger.

threads.title: 820-00165 Random Power-On Issues
threads.message:
Do NOT connect LIO flex untill get the board booting.
Use mouse connected to onboard USB port for control.
Check SMC_LID signal if stable.
Maybe need to reball SMC.

threads.title: 820-00165 Random Power-On Issues
threads.message: Thanks! I?ve not checked SMC_LID, will do that on Monday.
